Crimes.Crime_Name: Inadmissibility on grounds of serious criminality
Legal_Issue: Did Immigration Officers breach procedural fairness by failing to inform the Applicant about the s. 44(1) report and referral for an Admissibility Hearing?
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 44(1) and (2)
Application_Facts: Applicant was convicted of trafficking, leading to an admissibility report. Officers Cobb and Ho acted within their limited discretion.
Decision_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness occurred
Defendant_Behavior: Officers did not inform applicant or allow submissions before decision
Legal_Standard: Procedural fairness requires minimal guarantees for administrative decisions
Assessment_Factor: Conviction for serious criminality under s. 36(1)(a)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to notify applicant of s. 44(1) report and referral
Application_Basis: Permanent resident with serious criminal conviction
Governing_Rule: Under s. 44(1) and (2), officers may prepare report and refer for hearing without prior notice if based on relevant facts
Decisional_Body: Immigration Officers, subject to judicial review
Cause_Description: Applicant's conviction for drug trafficking led to inadmissibility proceedings
Evidence_Handling: Report prepared based on conviction details
Residency_Compliance: Permanent resident status affected due to inadmissibility
Evidence_Assessment: Conviction established factual basis for report
Decision_Rationale: Procedural fairness did not require informing applicant or allowing submissions at reporting stage

Dispute_Type: Judicial review of immigration officer’s decision
Legal_Provision_Involved: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, s. 44(1), s. 44(2), s. 36(1)(a)
Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Failure to inform applicant of s. 44(1) report and referral, and not allowing written submissions
Evidence_Disclosure_Status: Not disclosed to applicant prior to decision
Decision_Outcome: No breach of procedural fairness occurred
Assessment_Factor: Four-year sentence for drug trafficking indicating seriousness
Procedural_Requirement: No obligation to notify or solicit submissions at s. 44(1) stage
Basis_for_Decision: Conviction for trafficking in controlled substance with four-year sentence
Procedural_Fairness_Issues: Lack of notice and opportunity to respond before report
Basis_for_Inadmissibility: Drug trafficking conviction meeting threshold of serious criminality
Procedural_Issue: Timing and transparency of s. 44(1) report
Legal_Issue: Whether failure to inform applicant breaches procedural fairness
Relevant_Factors_Considered: Nature of offense, length of sentence, immigration status
Decision_Level: Initial officer decision, reviewed by Federal Court
